title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 

31A(6A)) (Covid-19) (No. 4) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 22nd day of October
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health act 1947 (section 31a(6a)) (covid-19) (no 4) regulation 2020 (2) regulation shall come operation 22nd day october

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. The following provisions of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A -
text_raw:
2. The following provisions of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - 
Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 8) Regulations 2020 (S.I. 448 of 
2020), being penal provisions for the purposes of section 31A of the Health Act 
1947 (No. 28 of 1947), are prescribed to be relevant provisions for the 
purposes of the Criminal Justice (Enforcement Powers) (Covid -19) Act 2020 
(No. 14 of 2020): 

(a) 

paragraph (1) of Regulation 12; 

(b) paragraphs (1), (2) and (3) of Regulation 13. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 October, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [449] 3

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These regulations provide for the penal provisions relating to premises licensed 
for the sale or supply of intoxicating liquor for consumption on the premises 
under the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) 
(No. 8) Regulations (S.I. No. 448 of 2020) to become relevant provisions for 
the purposes of the Criminal Justice (Enforcement Powers) (Covid-19) Act
